cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SY 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category cs.CL (Computation and Language) because it deals with speech synthesis, which is a natural language processing task. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of recurrent neural networks (RNNs) and long short-term memory (LSTM) architecture, which are commonly used in language modeling and speech recognition. 

The paper could also belong to the sub-category cs.SD (Sound) because it deals with speech synthesis, which is a sound-related task. 

The sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also likely because the paper discusses the use of neural networks for speech synthesis. 

The sub-category cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also possible because the paper discusses the use of gated recurrent neural networks, which are a type of neural network. 

Finally, the sub-category cs.SY (Systems and Control) is also possible because the paper proposes a simplified architecture for speech synthesis, which could be seen as a control system.
